comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This would seem to be a celebration of the 25th anniversary of the accession to the Bulgarian throne of Ferdinand I, who by 1912 was styled Tsar, a title he bestowed upon himself. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferdinand_I_of_Bulgaria Medals and stamps were also issued to mark the occasion. Another Bain collection photo shows a procession going through a very similar arch. Maybe it's the same arch, other side. The words on the arch are different, however. Other Bain photos show royal celebrations of the Crown Prince's Boris' 21st birthday, also in 1912.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks artolog for your research. The dates seem to match other images related to Ferdinand I, and his declaring himself czar in 1912.  I think that we'll leave this one as is to see if any more information comes in.
